column5: IT's been over 10 years on DUI, Do I need Any paperwork or anything to cross !
If it is over 10 years old you may be "deemed rehabilitated". Be nice to the customs officers where you cross.

If it is your only DUI you are deemed rehabilitated. Remember, it is not the date of the DUI, but the conclusion of your sentence date which must be more than 10 years old. Anything from 5 to 10 years the border guard is given the discretion of letting you in or not. Be nice and truthful and it will not be an issue. Enjoy the trip.

thanks guy's, I feel better, Was told the 10 year thing a few years ago and It's now a few months after 10 years that it was settled. nothing since ! had to pass on many trips in past, but I got a good feeling now I'll make it through. TOMORROW !
word of advice.. dont bring booze across with you.. if you declare alcohol,, i dont see how thet would possibly be able too consider you rehabilitated.
Just go over in a vehicle that is not registered in your name.
